en: After giving the law, Moses confirms the covenant between God and the people.
Blood becomes a visible sign of this covenant.

lines: When Moses had proclaimed every commandment of the law to all the people,
he took the blood of calves,
together with water, scarlet wool and branches of hyssop,
and sprinkled the scroll and all the people.
“This is the blood of the covenant,
which God has commanded you to keep.”
he sprinkled with the blood both the tabernacle
and everything used in its ceremonies.
The law requires that nearly everything be cleansed with blood,
and without the shedding of blood

question.en: What do you notice about the connection between covenant, cleansing, and forgiveness in this passage?
